I actually made this post like a LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOONG time ago on my blog. But after deleting it (for personal reasons), I had to find some other way to salvage this because this took me ages to make, video and post-wise.
Catchy title, huh?

The Original Video

Obviously it isn't from the direct source itself, but a product of someone saving it after the owners deleted it and uploaded onto their own account. Why? I haven't the faintest clue, but my general thought is so they can parade and demand attention/commentary on how 'stupid these dumb sluts are har har'. Obviously this video was made to attract the lowest common denominator. Wait, what does that make me then?

So What The Hell Actually Happened?

So we have these two teenage girls named Maddy and Tiana who apparently come from Melbourne, Australia (because of their passing mention of St. Kilda - which is a place known for its 'prostitutes' which only frightens me because I essentially live in the goddamn same city as these two) made a video ranting about, you guessed it, skanky sluts and little teenybopper tryhards who try to mimic everything they do/say/wear. They also briefly touch on stuff like pubescent kids already out there drinking and smoking and their hatred of girls who '(cam)whore themselves out in their Facebook photos' and post really inane/spam the 'like this if [insert trivial thing here]' Facebook statuses. Apparently, or so the story goes - it had been up for about two hours before they took it down because of all the intense backlash, flaming and death/rape threats, etc. Some of you may be asking, now how did dorky me come across such an atrocity? So there I was, just about to log into my youtube account when I briefly glance at the top recommended videos of the day. Normally they're the videos gone viral and generally are stuff I wouldn't poke with a 10ft pole, whether it is out of distaste or general disinterest. However, so I see the title of this video and I am intrigued because of it's title. Sluts and Tryhards You Need to Watch This Yeah, you can obviously tell how real classy this video was going to be. So maybe out of morbid/stupid curiosity - I clicked on it, because in all honesty - I was actually curious on what the hell these two were going on about. From my own judgmental perspective, I tried to gleaned from what I saw - the title, the looks of the two girls and I figured, this was either going to be hilariously bad or be intensely infuriating for me to get through. If you hadn't watched my video response by now, I'll give you the short answer: the video just downright pissed me off. Now I've address of the "main" issues I had with the video but because I am so nice, and just in the mood to rant (because who honestly is reading these things, seriously) - I think I am just going to go over them again. Briefly. (Please ignore the italics, I am obviously trying to pass that as sarcasm). The Short Version of All Things Nhi Got Pissed Off When Watching This Video 1. The excessive use of swearing. Seriously, I don't condemn a few cuss words every now and again, especially when you're ranting but there is no need to say 'fuck' every 5 seconds. This may be just my pet peeve, but I have a real big agenda on people who constantly swear in every sentence because by then, I will not and will never take you seriously and will have that compulsion to bash your head in with a dictionary of some sorts. You know, the heavy Macquarie/Oxford/fancy kind. Don't be fooled by the image, folks! This isn't the general 'we can hold in one hand' kind that I was accustomed to in primary. Oh no. This is the massive, sized of my Biology textbook and 'weighing a goddamn ton' kind. 2. The apparent misogyny and slut-shaming these girls were perpetrating I'm not going to lie, I will confess to divulging into some slut-shaming myself - mostly during my teenage years where we'd bitch about some girl we had a mutual dislike for. As always, they were generally the girls who wore the most revealing outfits, wore excessive make-up/hair extensions/hair products, were constantly on Facebook/some other social media, had everyone believe they were pretty vapid and insipid, as well as shallow and generally looked down on the rest of us who didn't place their appearance and popularity above everything else. But I digress, this is the kind of behavior and mindset that is pretty damaging for people - especially women who want to be able to live her life as she wants it without the rest of the world calling her one name or another. It is bad enough that we're taught to be competitive against other women for most of our lives (especially with men, because clearly they are always our number one priority - regardless of the fact that not all women are cis-gendered, heterosexual or simply don't care) for the things we want and naturally put others down in order to feel better about ourselves. Or so I've heard. Anyway, I generally think these girls are nothing but a product of our time. With our sex-saturated culture, the media haunting our every waking moment (thanks to more portable gadgets and whatnot) and other terrible resources - it really is no surprise that these girls, and every other idiot who think the same line as they do (especially the commentators/video responses - as much as they don't believe it) Most of it I talked about in the video and I am generally not that bothered to rewrite out everything all over again - so I won't. By the end of the video, it was nice to know that these girls also seem to suffer from the misogynistic 'special snowflake' syndrome where the girls they were morally superior because they were 'one of the boys' (because they don't have much 'girl friends' and only needed each other plus a select few) and didn't lower themselves to the catty, stupid behavior that other girls do. Whatever, I have much more important things to do than listen to this drivel. 3. The kind of responses this video generated I've said it before, this video was obviously catering to the lowest common denominator. The kind of people we'd avoid during high school or anywhere, really. Well, if you were me anyway. Now I could not stand the amount of misogyny, slut-shaming and general wankery that went on in this video - and I sure as hell didn't appreciate it from the responses either. I generally could not stand the bullshit people were spewing out. Whether they were basically just making poor, poor parodies of the video or outright yelling about how ugly and skanky these girls were - I refused to continue having no one call out on these people for their awful behavior. The funniest/worst part of it - is this is generally done with the big message that "we shouldn't judge others for their looks". Hypocrites, you all are. If you saw this on Youtube, you can obviously tell that I barely got any views. Well I apologize greatly that my video, with it just scraping by with 100 hits - pale greatly in comparison to the other responses that got well over 10,000+ hits. What was I doing that clearly wasn't groping for the same amount of attention these other video were doing? I am not sure. Maybe people just want to laugh and put someone else down in order to feel better about themselves and feel so morally self-righteous that they would never stoop to the level of this 'dumb skanks' or whatever. Maybe are really not in the mood to watch stuff that is trying to encourage them to think and realize the harm this kind of bullcrap is perpetrating. I don't know, maybe I'm just not pretty enough or something. (Sarcasm, it's back again). I made this video because I wanted the world to have a nice, coherent response from a self-proclaimed feminist's perspective. Where I argued with actual logic and remain pretty open-minded about it and judged these girls not on their looks but on the content they're saying and their message behind it. Where I didn't, you know, had to stoop low to just using derogatory insults, death/rape threats and just being an idiot about it, basically. Clearly, I ain't doing something right here.

Dear Diary, Once upon a time, back in the good old high school days where John and I were much more ambitious and productive and motivated - we egged each other to do this 'chapter a day' kind of thing. Essentially it was to write a snippet of our current WIP and hopefully we'd have written so much that all we had to do was smush it altogether, edit the flying fuck out of it and have our own manuscript. And this was meant to go for every day, and for the days we didn't - we'd have to write a smut fic of a pairing we weren't comfortable at doing (i.e. me with yaoi, and John with writing heterosexual people doing it). So obviously you can tell that the writing exercise went NOWHERE and that 'project' has been abandoned like many great things-to-be do. However, I found this little excerpt hiding away on my computer and upon reading it - was struck by the nostalgia and fondness of writing things because I could and wasn't held back by my desire to be profound and thought-provoking with EACH PIECE OF WRITING I'LL EVER CONCEIVE and that fear of being all 'herp a derp' like Stephenie Meyer and whatnot. I dunno, maybe I'm just trying to do some spring-cleaning of my computer and these silly, girlish ideas of me becoming an writer and then actually doing something about it will always remain mutually exclusive. This is just a backstory info dump, regarding the characters for this WIP I had always wanted to do, something I had been working on since I was a wee little lass in the fourth grade. It was meant to be the first of my mystery series, as well as dealing with the usual shenanigans of primary to high school. Essentially it was my crossover hybrid of the Babysitters Club and Linda Bailey's Stevie Diamond mystery books and a bunch of other things. You can find other snippets of an old WIP (which I'll probably never get around to working on) here: I, II, III, IV, V, VI, VII Warning: These excerpts are in no chronological order and will probably make no sense, and are unfunny and uninteresting to the average reader. Heed with caution. -- The Founding History of the Fabulous Five So I suppose I should explain on how a more dysfunctional bunch of unlikely people ended up being branded together as our group. Chloe and I had been best friends for God knows how long. Brian used to hang out with us as well, but he would always run off with the other boys in what sport they were playing in that week. We used to have another best friend, Kate Morgston -- but she left in grade three for Queensland and never came back. There was also Chloe's other best friend, Zack O'Sullivan - who I swear to God used to be our school equivalent of a basketball hoop. That was how tall he was, and how many times people used to throw balls at his head. It seems that he was immune to pain, constantly fixated on his Gameboy and nothing else. Except maybe Chloe, who was the only person he actually talked to. I had to share MY best friend with him, and all I got was the occasional nod and grunting noise. But he left at the end of grade four, since his parents had officially gotten divorced and his dad got custody of him, resulting him to move off to military school. Or the loony bin, as some people used to say. I can't say that I was sad he was leaving, but I know that his leaving hit Chloe the hardest. Not only was he an extremely close childhood friend of hers (sometimes when I wasn't there, those two were inseparable) but was the first guy that Chloe liked, and he liked her back. He made a promise that he'd come back for her, but I have my doubts. If he didn't, he knows that he'd prepare to be punched into oblivion by me and Brian if he showed his face around these parts ever again. Even to this day, I'd still say that Bridget was the most surprising addition to our magic social circle. It's not to say that we have this 'us and her' mentality, but believe me when I say its extremely weird having an ex-popular hang out with us nerds like its the most normal thing in the world. It wasn't always like that. I know that she and Ben had always been extremely close, even to a point where they got engaged in grade six to prove how much they liked it each other. I'm not exactly sure how long their marriage lasted, but I know it had its rocky ups and down. Then Bridget made friends with Kelly (mega bitch) and that got her integrated into the popular clique with Ms. Oh So Perfect Courtney and her legion of lackeys. I don't know what their exact feelings were on awkward but perky Ben, but I supposed they accept him in a polite way. Kind of like when your friend asks for your opinion on their work or something, and you haven't got the heart to say it's shit because you know it'd hurt their feelings. Well most of them did, except Kelly. I think she always made it exceptionally clear that Ben was only allowed to hang out with Them because of Bridget. So like an formulaic episode of a preteen female tv show -- Bridget became more interested in shopping, boys and hanging out with her new best friends, eventually neglecting Ben for the new glamours of being a teenager. I think it was Chloe who introduced him into our group (which was pretty much me and Chloe) since they were arranged to sit next to each other in Humanties. So by that point, it was just the three of us. Sometimes Brian would come hang out with us, but it most likely because he wanted to scab money off me, or his mates have all landed in detention (and he didn't, surprisingly enough) or something. I think it's sad that it took Bridget a cheating boyfriend to realize that some friendships weren't worth giving up. After becoming official for going around with Richard for a week, imagine everyone's surprise when he did the exact same thing - but only with Kelly. Fireworks ensured, along with the bunch of fake rumours by Kelly and Courtney that spread like wildfire and Bridget broke off from the group and self-invited herself into our group. It took a LOT of time, grovelling and trips to the tuckshop before Ben came to forgive Bridget and we had another number to our group. I remember that process being extremely awkward, seeing as Bridget hung out with them, and they weren't exactly the nicest to people who thought were socially beneath them (i.e. me and Chloe). So I always used to panic that Bridget would bitch about our dorkiness behind our backs, but she proved to be a perfectly nice (albeit bossy and scary) person. She and Kelly eventually made amends, sadly enough - and they actually are still friends. I think most of the populars miss her too, but Bridget likes telling us that it's Queen Bee Courtney that has some qualms with her. In year 9, Cathy - who was Bridget's cousin - moved to our school. I swear I have never met someone more of a polar opposite to Bridget. While Bridget was highly opinionated, loud, bossy and pretty damn right scary when she chooses to be -- Cathy was very more laidback and flighty. If I had to compare her to someone, I'd say Luna Lovegood straight out of Harry Potter. Except people thought she's was hot and I have never seen her without a boyfriend or guy after her at any given time of the week. That's not to say that those two did not get along. I think these two had that eerily close bond where if Bridget told Cathy to jump, all she'd have to say was from where. But I can tell you one thing that these cousins have in common - it's that they have balls. Seriously, I remember when Cathy pretended to snub us off and hang out with the popular group, only to backlash and terrorized them for what they did to us, especially to Bridget. When we asked about it, she said that she and Bridget had planned it out before she came and decided to do it for the laughs. I don't know what kind of humour you'd classify that as, but having Kelly and Courtney get yelled at someone that was practically a head shorter than them will always warm my heart. So that was basically how our gang was made, and I personally would not have it any other way.

Title: Make it Last Forever - Friendship Never Ends! Rating: T Warning: Any similarities to actual persons (living or dead) are just of mere and very, very unfortunate coincidence. Also, be wary of Mary Sues, inconsistent characters, plotholes, the works. Disclaimers: Any reference to pop culture, or of any general kind do not belong to me. Previous chapters: I, II, III, IV, V, VI, VII-A, VII-B, VIII, IX, X, XI ,XII, XIII, XIV, XV, XVI, XVII, XVIII, VIX, XX, XXI, XXII, XXIII, XXIV -- "Trianus?" Trianus hummed, briefly looking to his left where Katalina was fiddling with the hem of her skirt. There was something oddly pleasant about the way she said his name; the way her small, soft little voice whispered his name like a gentle breeze fluttering by. He had some compulsion to make her talk. It didn't matter what she was talking about, just as long as she kept saying his name. "This isn't the way to Matilda's house," she said, as she gazed outside the window. Katalina seemed to have an soft and pale glow against the dark upholstery of the car. Tilting her head, Trianus eyed her shoulders, gazing over the faint outline of her collarbone. He suddenly had a strange compulsion to just lean over, and kiss the nape of her neck - to see if it felt just as soft like it looked... Trianus suddenly felt a bit too stifled and uncomfortable, even though the inside of the car was reasonably warm. "We're picking my brother up. He's gonna go to his own gig, then we're going off to your friend's place," he explained, as he parked in front of an old brick house. A white caravan, adorned with twinkling Christmas-lights stood proudly in the driveway. Trianus suddenly got out of the car. "Wait here," he said, staring especially at Will. "I'll be right back." "I wonder..." Katalina trailed off, her face pressed against the window as they watched him enter the house. "Who do you think lives in that caravan, Will?" Will waggled his eyebrows. "I bet that's where he brings in all those women he lures in. It's probably where he makes his babies, Katie-chan." "Ew, that's just gross!" Katalina shrieked, immediately pulling herself away from the window. "But do you... do you think he-" He simply shook his head. "Katalina, will you relax?" Will grinned, squinting to get a closer look at the two figures walking out of the house. "It's obvious. That guy is dead gone on you. I bet he probably wants to bring YOU into his little love-den. You know, to do a little dance, make a LOT of love..." Katalina's face flushed a ferocious shade of red, just as the doors of the car was opened. Trianus resumed the driver's seat, whereas his brother -- who was adorned in an Anakin Skywalker robe get-up - sat in the backseat with Will. "What are you doing?"
